alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Southern Columbia; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 2:38PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GILCHRIST...CENTRAL BRADFORD...NORTHWESTERN ALACHUA...SOUTHERN UNION AND SOUTH CENTRAL COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 238 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Upland Pines to 6 miles east of Trenton. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Lake Butler, Raiford, Worthington Spring, Alachua, High Springs, Worthington Springs, University Of Florida, Groves, and Beasley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Southern Columbia; Western Alachua
